title: Detect Cycle in a Linked List
text: Given a linked list, determine if it has a cycle.
solution:
def has_cycle(head):
    slow = fast = head
    while fast and fast.next:
        slow = slow.next
        fast = fast.next.next
        if slow == fast: return True
    return False

title: Always Running
text: I run, yet I have no legs. I have a mouth but never speak. What am I?

title: The More You Take
text: The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?

title: Invisible Weight
text: I’m light as a feather, yet the strongest man can’t hold me for much longer than a minute. What am I?

title: Room Without Doors
text: I have cities, but no houses. I have mountains, but no trees. I have water, but no fish. What am I?

title: Always in Front
text: I am always in front of you but can’t be seen. What am I?

title: Break Me
text: The more of me you take, the more you leave behind. Break me and I’ll still be the same. What am I?

title: Timeless Traveler
text: I have hands but can’t clap. I have a face but no eyes. What am I?

title: Full Without Eating
text: I can be full but never eat. I can fall but never rise. What am I?

title: Always Running, Never Tired
text: I go around the world but always stay in a corner. What am I?

title: Hidden in Plain Sight
text: I’m taken from a mine and shut in a wooden case, from which I am never released, and yet I am used by almost every person. What am I?
